snippet: PULLMAN--Maynard Edward, died January 28, 2016, at age 88. Survived by his beloved wife of 67 years, Phyllis (Light), daughters Cydney, Valerie and Jacky, six grandchildren, brother George. Born in Chicago on October 26, 1927. PhD from Johns Hopkins University. He was chief of biochemistry at the Public Health Research Institute in New York City, and research professor at NYU, Columbia and the University of Sao Paulo. Known for his pioneering work in bioenergetics. 1/3
lead_paragraph: PULLMAN--Maynard Edward, died January 28, 2016, at age 88. Survived by his beloved wife of 67 years, Phyllis (Light), daughters Cydney, Valerie and Jacky, six grandchildren, brother George. Born in Chicago on October 26, 1927. PhD from Johns Hopkins University. He was chief of biochemistry at the Public Health Research Institute in New York City, and research professor at NYU, Columbia and the University of Sao Paulo. Known for his pioneering work in bioenergetics. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  PULLMAN, MAYNARD EDWARD
